org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers

Interface PersistenceRenderer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Copyable<PersistenceRenderer>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPersistenceRenderer, CollectionRenderer, FlatteningCollectionRenderer, LeafNodeRenderer, MapRenderer

    public interface PersistenceRenderer
extends Copyable<PersistenceRenderer>
    Interface defining what a PersistenceRenderer should look like. The PersistenceRenderers are intended to be used to create key-value pairs during the flattening of the semantic model. The PersistenceRenderers are intended to be part of the recursive algorithm in which the KeyValueBuilders call the buildKeyValuePair(InfoNode, String, List, boolean) method, which in turn, for compound InfoNodes may call the KeyValueBuilder.buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List) or the KeyValueBuilder.createKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List, boolean) methods. It ends up being a beautiful dance of between the builders and renderers...though the code isn't so pretty.

        getCopy

    • Method Detail

      • buildKeyValuePair

        void buildKeyValuePair(InfoNode infoNode,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues,
                     boolean isWithholdPersistName)
        Builds a key-value pair and adds it to the list of key-value pairs. If the InfoNode is compound, then the PersistenceRenderer may refer back to the KeyValueBuilder to build out the compound node.
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current InfoNode in the semantic model.
        key - The current key. The key is constructed by appending persistence names, which may or may not be decorated, to the current key. In this way it represents a flattening of the semantic model.
        keyValues - The current list of key-value pairs
        isWithholdPersistName - true if the renderer implementation should not append the InfoNode's persistence name to the key.

      • buildInfoNode

        void buildInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                 java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Builds an InfoNode and adds it to the parent node, using the specified list of key-value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The parent InfoNode to which to add the newly created child(ren).
        keyValues - The associated list of key value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.

      • isRenderer

        boolean isRenderer(java.lang.String keyElement)
        Returns true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        keyElement - The element of the key to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise

      • getGroupName

        java.lang.String getGroupName(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the group name for the key. For example, if the key is "people{"test"}[0].Person" then the group name from the MapRenderer will be "people"
        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to extract the group name
        Returns:
        the group name for the key
